      • setGUIHidden

        protected void setGUIHidden​(boolean isHideGUI)
        Set the flag that indicates if the GUI is hidden. If so, dialog messages are sent to the command line or a dialog box. Any dialogs requiring user input, including question message dialogs, are displayed in dialog boxes
        Parameters:
        isHideGUI - true if dialog messages should appear on the command line; false to display the message in a dialog box

      • isGUIHidden

        Get the status of the flag that indicates if the GUI is hidden
        Returns:
        true if the GUI is not visible

        Start the web server
        Parameters:
        gui - 'gui' if the graphical user interface should be displayed; any other text to not show the user interface and to direct dialog messages to the command line

      • setPreFunctionDbSpecificHandlers

        protected void setPreFunctionDbSpecificHandlers()
        Create the handler classes that rely on a successful connection to a project database (other than the default). Set the references to these handlers in the persistent classes that use them. Any handlers that are needed to create the project-specific PostgreSQL functions must be created here

      • setPostFunctionDbSpecificHandlers

        protected void setPostFunctionDbSpecificHandlers()
        Create the handler classes that rely on the project-specific PostgreSQL functions. Start the web server if enabled

      • parseDbSpecificCommandLineCommands

        protected void parseDbSpecificCommandLineCommands()
        Execute the command line commands that depend on a project database being open

      • showSearchDialog

        protected void showSearchDialog​(CcddConstants.SearchDialogType searchType,
                                java.lang.Long targetRow,
                                CcddEventLogDialog eventLogToSearch,
                                java.awt.Component parent)
        Display the search dialog for searching database tables, scripts, and event logs
        Parameters:
        searchType - search dialog type: TABLES, SCRIPTS, or LOG
        targetRow - row index to match if this is an event log entry search on a table that displays only a single log entry; null otherwise
        eventLogToSearch - event log to search; null if not searching a log
        parent - GUI component over which to center the dialog

        protected void setGUIActivated​(boolean activate)
        Activate/deactivate the main menu by setting the component enable flags appropriately. While disabled these components are grayed out and do not respond to inputs
        Parameters:
        activate - true to enable the GUI components, false to disable

      • createMenu

        protected javax.swing.JMenu createMenu​(javax.swing.JMenuBar menuBar,
                                       java.lang.String name,
                                       int key,
                                       int occurrence,
                                       java.lang.String toolTip)
        Create a menu and add it to a menu bar
        Parameters:
        menuBar - menu bar to add the menu to
        name - menu name
        key - key mnemonic for the menu
        occurrence - specifies which occurrence of the character in the item name to highlight; set to < 2 to use the first occurrence
        toolTip - tool tip text
        Returns:
        Menu created

        menu - menu to add the item to
        name - menu item name
        key - key mnemonic for the menu item
        occurrence - specifies which occurrence of the character in the item name to highlight; set to < 2 to use the first occurrence
        toolTip - tool tip text
        isSelected - true to have the check box selected initially
        Returns:
        Check box menu item created

        Radio button menu item created

      • updateRecentProjectsMenu

        protected void updateRecentProjectsMenu()
        Create/update the recently opened project menu items

      • updateRecentTablesMenu

        protected void updateRecentTablesMenu()
        Create/update the recently opened tables menu items in the main window command menu and each open table editor command menu. The table name in the menu item is the shortened form used in the table editor tab (root: prototype.variable) in order to shorten the menu item length; the item's too tip displays the full table path. The table name in the menu is preceded by a number, which is used as the hot key

      • exitApplication

        protected void exitApplication​(boolean withConfirm,
                               int status)
        Exit the CCDD application
        Parameters:
        withConfirm - true to ask for confirmation to exit; false to exit without confirmation
        status - exit status value: 0 for normal exit, non-zero for abnormal

      • getLookAndFeel

        protected java.lang.String getLookAndFeel()
        Get the application look and feel
        Returns:
        name of the selected look and feel

      • setLookAndFeel

        protected boolean setLookAndFeel​(java.lang.String laf)
        Set the application's look and feel
        Parameters:
        laf - name of the selected look and feel; null to use the look and feel stored in the program preferences
        Returns:
        true if an error occurred loading the look and feel

      • updateGUI

        protected void updateGUI​(CcddConstants.GUIUpdateType updateType,
                         CcddDialogHandler[] dialogs)
        Update the visible graphical user interface (GUI) components for a change in the specified GUI update type
        Parameters:
        updateType - type of GUI update - LAF for look and feel; FONT for font; COLOR for color
        dialogs - array of other dialogs to update. This is used to update the Preferences dialog and its associated selection dialog (if applicable)

      • ignoreUncommittedChanges

        protected boolean ignoreUncommittedChanges​(java.lang.String dialogType,
                                           java.lang.String dialogMessage,
                                           boolean closeEditors,
                                           java.util.List<java.lang.String> tableTypes,
                                           java.awt.Component parent)
        Check if any of the open editors has uncommitted changes, and if so, ask the user if the operation should continue
        Parameters:
        dialogType - text to display in the dialog's header
        dialogMessage - message to display in the dialog box
        closeEditors - true to close any open table editors
        tableTypes - list of tables types that are being changed; null or an empty list if the caller is not the table type editor
        parent - GUI component over which to center the confirmation dialog
        Returns:
        true if there are no uncommitted changes or if the user elects to ignore the changes and continue with the operation; false if changes exist and the user cancels the operation
